text: The only thing necessary for the triumph of evil is for good men to do nothing.
author: Edmund Burke

text: All the world's a stage, and all the men and women merely players: they have their exits and their entrances and one man in his time plays many parts, his acts being seven ages.
author: William Shakespeare

text: Rarely do we find men who willingly engage in hard, solid thinking. There is an almost universal quest for easy answers and half-baked solutions. Nothing pains some people more than having to think.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: A nation or civilization that continues to produce soft-minded men purchases its own spiritual death on the installment plan.
author: Martin Luther King, Jr.

text: Security is mostly a superstition. It does not exist in nature, nor do the children of men as a whole experience it. Avoiding danger is no safer in the long run than outright exposure. Life is either a daring adventure, or nothing.
author: Helen Keller
